instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3302: What is 820-3302? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A fan full speed when plug-in (before power on)
threads.message:
Hello,

on an iMac where I had a video issue (no display on internal screen), I replaced <CAPACITOR>C9796</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C9719</CAPACITOR>, L9100 and <CAPACITOR>C9120</CAPACITOR>...
now everything is ok, excepted that when I plug the Mac on electric plug, the fans are going full speed.
When I press the power button, it starts normally and fans are going back to normal speeds and everything works fine.

What could I check to fix that?

Sincerely,

julien Favier

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A fan full speed when plug-in (before power on)
